cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast toward the Florida Panhandle, then accelerating across the southeastern United States and emerging offshore near the North Carolina / Virginia border into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near or just east of Panama City, FL

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect along the northern Gulf Coast from the Mississippi/Alabama border to Yankeetown, FL and Grand Isle, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River (not applicable to Virginia)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA-FL) Saturday, then inland across GA/SC, reaching coastal NC and southeastern VA late Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.wind: Gusty northeast to east winds of 25–35 mph with an outside chance (≤7%) of reaching tropical-storm force Sunday night into Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the Virginia ports; surge threat confined to Florida Gulf Coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible late Sunday through Monday with localized higher amounts, potentially producing brief ponding on terminals and access roads
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated wave action in Chesapeake Bay and approaches; minor coastal flooding during high-tide cycles possible
